input_text:
Job Title: Sr. Specialist- Program Management

Location: Lexington Park, MD

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Title

Sr. Specialist- Program Management

KBR is seeking an FMS Senior Program Analyst, Logistician in support of NAVSUP Weapon Systems Support, in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. In this role, you will provide logistics analysts supporting aircraft, weapon systems, training, or Support Equipment (SE) programs. Conducts logistics, supportability, reliability, maintainability, and operational analyses and provides recommendations for tailoring, optimizing, and establishing logistics element requirements in support of aircraft, weapon systems, training, or SE programs.

Role And Responsibilities

Provides recommendations for changes to site support including maintenance planning, phased support, manpower and personnel requirements, initial provisioning and material support, support equipment, training and training devices, technical data packaging, handling, storage and transportation, facilities, and life cycle support.Provides recommendations for the development of Life Cycle Cost (LCC) and Total Ownership Cost (TOC) Management Plans.Provides recommendations for the review and development of Maintenance Plans/Logistics Support Analysis (MP/LSA) records, maintenance tasks and Level of Repair (LOR) Analysis recommendations.Support and attends reviews, meetings, conferences, briefings and other significant support activities and events occurring in CONUS or other country locations, as required, to perform analysis in support of the PMA-265 Swiss IPT.Analyzes prospective changes to aircraft/weapons/support equipment spares quantities and determine the potential effects that these changes will have on program life cycle support.Evaluates maintenance capabilities and assess their applicability to support the Swiss F/A-18 weapon systems and/or support equipment.Tracks milestones and action items based on review and analysis of the LOA, contract schedules, In-Service Support Plan, and other pertinent documentation.Coordinate, support, and attends program management reviews, technical coordination meetings, conferences, briefings and other significant program activities and events occurring in CONUS and OCONUS, as required.

Location:

NAVSUP Weapon Systems Support (WSS), Philadelphia, PARemote may be possible depending on customer needs.

Basic Qualifications

BA/BS degree plus 10 years of experience to include acquisition level of repair analysis (LORA), Maintenance Planning, Logistics Support/Supportability Analysis, Operational Availability analysis, or resource requirements analysis related to in-service support of DoD weapons systems.Life Cycle Costing, Deactivation, Demilitarization, and Disposal (3D Planning) experience is desired.Microsoft Office Suite, O365, and SharePoint experience is required.An active secret level security clearance is required.

Preferred Skills

General knowledge of NAVAIR and NAVSUP WSS policies, procedures, terminology, and requirements.Demonstrated experience in management of program/project status.

KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

R2086924

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
